# Collaborators

- **[Paul van Dam-Bates](https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-van-dam-bates-0a4988b1)** is a research scientist at Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) who has contributed to NIMBLE's Laplace and nested approximation algorithms as well as various other pieces of NIMBLE. 
- **[Wei Zhang](https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/mathematicsstatistics/staff/weizhang/)** is a lecturer in the School of Mathematics and Statistics at the University of Glasgow who has contributed to NIMBLE methods and applications.
- **[Sally Paganin](https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/profile/sally-paganin/)** is a faculty member at Ohio State University who has contributed to NIMBLE methods and applications.
- **Claudia Wehrhahn Cortes** was a visiting assistant professor at the University of California, Santa Cruz, Department of Applied Mathematics & Statistics who implemented Bayesian nonparametric methods in NIMBLE.
- **[Abel Rodriguez](https://stat.uw.edu/about-us/people/abel-rodriguez)** is a faculty member at the University of Washington Department of Statistics who helped lead our implementation of Bayesian nonparametric methods in NIMBLE.

# Core team alums

- **[Duncan Temple Lang](http://www.stat.ucdavis.edu/~duncan/)** is in the Department of Statistics at the University of California, Davis who provided guidance on package structure and the NIMBLE compiler.
- **Nick Michaud** is a Statistician at Vertex Pharmaceuticals who contributed to various NIMBLE algorithms and NIMBLE internals as a postdoc.
- **[Clifford Anderson-Bergman](http://cliffstats.weebly.com/)** is a Statistician at Lawrence Livermore National Lab who contributed to various NIMBLE algorithms and NIMBLE internals.
- **Jagadish Babu** contributed to an early pre-release version of NIMBLE.
